title: Sacha Lichine 2016 Single Blend Rosé (Vin de France)
description: Produced from Languedoc grapes by the Château d'Esclans team in Provence, this is an easy, open wine with both red berry richness and delicious acidity Drink now.

title: Pelissero 2014 Nubiola  (Barbaresco)
description: This opens with eucalyptus, dark spice and menthol aromas. The palate offers vanilla, cranberry white pepper and toast flavors framed by firm acidity and tight, grainy tannins.

title: The Infinite Monkey Theorem 2015 Malbec (Grand Valley)
description: Black plum and black currant are jammy on the brambly nose. The smooth tannins take a backseat to the jammy and plummy black fruits on the medium-bodied palate. There is just enough acidity to keep this wine from turning flabby. Black plum, a touch of baking spice and warmth linger on the finish.

title: Ollivier Frères 2016 Domaine de la Grenaudière La Grenouille Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: Soft, fruity and lightly crisp, this is a wine to drink young to keep its freshness. It has perfumed acidity and a lightly zesty lemon aftertaste.
designation: Domaine de la Grenaudière La Grenouille Sur Lie

title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Azul Portugal Rosé (Península de Setúbal)
description: Made from 100% Castelâo, the local grape of Setúbal, this wine is attractively fruity, with a crisp texture. Warmer, ripe red-berry fruits contrast with the acidity, leaving a balanced wine that is ready to drink.

title: François Millet 2016 Domaine des Côtes Blanches Rosé (Sancerre)
description: This crisp red-currant-flavored wine is packed with acidity. It is tense and juicy with a light brushstroke of vanilla. But it is the intense acidity that sets the tone for this wine. Make this a food—not an apéritif—wine.

title: Gabriel Meffre 2016 La Châsse Syrah Rosé (Vin de France)
description: Syrah-like aromas make this an attractive, soft wine. Its red berry fruit and balanced acidity are well in place for warm-weather drinking.

title: Gruet 2012 Gilbert Grande Reserve Sparkling (America)
description: Aromas of lemon juice and graham cracker show on the nose and carry to the persistantly foamy palate. Additional notes of apple and orange peel offer some depth but fade quickly from unrelenting acidity.

title: Hancock & Hancock 2016 Home Vineyard Grenache Rosé (McLaren Vale)
description: Bright, lean and vibrant, this is a medium-bodied rosé with gingery-citrusy notes that could go well with fish or poultry dishes.

title: Herdade do Rocim 2015 Touriga Nacional (Alentejano)
description: This wine is earthy, with a yeasty edge. It offers plenty of Touriga Nacional's perfumed fruit although this is masked by a barnyard character that needs to blow away. The wine requires another year to show its full potential, so drink from 2018.

title: La Vieille Ferme 2016 Rosé (Vin de France)
description: This is a pale, light-bodied rosé with aromas and flavors reminiscent of underripe peach and melon. It's clean, dry and even a bit austere on the finish, making it a fine apéritif.

title: Zolo 2016 Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)
description: Lean, largely neutral citrus aromas set up a palate with medium weight. Melon, pineapple and passion-fruit flavors are fresh but minimal. A bright finish makes this a good match for ceviche.
designation: Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled

title: Tussock Jumper 2015 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)
description: This fruity red wine has firm tannins and juicy acidity. Its soft, rounded aftertaste makes it easy and warm.

title: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2016 Marestango Rosé (Ile de Beauté)
description: Sourced from vineyards on the east coast of Corsica, this attractive, fruity wine is made from 100% Sciaccarellu. Its lively, light and crisp red currant and lemon flavors make it ready to drink.
winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

title: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2016 Terra Santa Rosé (Ile de Beauté)
description: This light, fruity wine is a perfect summer apéritif. With a crisp texture and attractive red fruit, it's lively and refreshing. Drink now.
winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

title: Casca Wines 2016 Monte Cascas Colheita Branco White (Douro)
description: The short lees aging has allowed this wine to ripen and fill out. Along with the citrus acidity, it has plenty of fresh apple fruit and a zesty texture. Drink now.

title: Casca Wines 2016 Monte Cascas Colheita Rosé (Douro)
description: A crisp and fruity blend of Douro grapes, this is packed with raspberry fruitiness, offering delicious acidity at the end. The wine is dry and ready to drink.

title: Château de Brigue NV Rouge Héritage Red (Vin de France)
description: This is an earthy, rustic wine with tannins that set its black fruit firmly in place. Juicy acidity and black currant flavor give it a lift on the finish. Drink from 2018.

title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Convento da Vila White (Alentejano)
description: This is a soft, fruity blend of Roupeiro, Rabo de Ovelha and Fernão Pires. It is ripe, full of apple and crisp green fruits, shot through with acidity. Drink now.

title: Alfredo Roca 2016 Fincas Tocai (Mendoza)
description: Overall this Tocai is fairly good from start to finish. Apple and matchstick aromas lead to a wide palate. Apple, peach and persimmon flavors show a bit of salt and finish short.

title: Altocedro 2016 Año Cero Pinot Noir (La Consulta)
description: Tea, tomato, baking spice and briny red-plum aromas lead to a creamy, almost candied palate. Flavors of plum and dried cherry carry plenty of oak plus pepper and spice notes. Finishing flavors of cocoa, nutmeg and clove are derivative of barrel aging.

title: Bougrier 2016 Domaine Guenault Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)
description: The wine is soft and open. It has some bright citrus and creamed-apple flavors that give it a ripe character. The wine is juicy, fruity and ready to drink.

title: M. & J-F Bertrand 2016 Fleur de Carbonnel Sauvignon Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)
description: This wine is fruity and soft, with hints of citrus and herbal flavors. Its acidity is bright and attractive. Drink now.

title: Gabriel Meffre 2015 La Châsse Merlot (Vin de France)
description: The is a soft, gentle wine with ripe berry fruit. Minimal tannins are embedded in its fruitiness and rounded texture. Drink now.

title: Finca El Origen 2015 Estate Blend Malbec-Cabernet Sauvignon (Uco Valley)
description: Furry berry and minty oak aromas are forced. This Cabernet-Malbec blend is saturated and intense to the point of being hard. Medicinal plum and berry flavors are basic, while a peppery shot of oaky mint returns on the finish.

title: Fiuza 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon-Touriga Nacional Red (Tejo)
description: Caramel and red-fruit aromas are followed by a soft-texture candy and fruity taste backed by acidity. Drink now.

title: Allan Scott 2013 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: Lightweight and lacking in texture, this wine offers fading red-cherry fruit, cola notes and leafy greens. Drink up.

title: Villebois 2016 Loupart Le Petit Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)
description: From a Loire Valley-based producer, this wine is crisp and cool. It has herbal touches and lively, citrusy acidity. Drink now.

title: Casca Wines 2016 Monte Cascas Colheita Branco White (Alentejano)
description: This wine that includes 65% Antão Vaz conjures up a warm, ripe character from the Alentejo. With its yellow fruits and almond flavors, it's soft although finished with some attractive acidity. Drink now.

title: Bougrier 2016  Muscadet
description: This is a simple fruity wine that is just right for the summer. Light citrus and orange-zest flavors give the wine its lift and brightness. Drink now.
